data.title: Films produced by Edward Selzer
data.text:
Overview: What's Opera, Doc? is a 1957 American Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies cartoon directed by Chuck Jones and written by Michael Maltese. The short was released on July 6, 1957, and stars Bugs Bunny and Elmer ...

Release date: 6 July 1957

Genre: Short, Music, Family, Comedy, Animation

Director: Chuck Jones

Producer: Edward Selzer

Bugs is in drag as the Valkyrie Brunhilde who sits on an overwieght horse. "She" is pursued by Elmer playing the demigod "Siegfried".

Overview: Three Little Bops is a 1957 American animated comedy short film directed by Friz Freleng and written by Warren Foster. A takeoff on The Three Little Pigs told as a hip, jazzy musical, the short features ...

Release date: 5 January 1957

Genre: Short, Comedy, Musical, Family, Animation

Director: Friz Freleng

Cast: Stan Freberg

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Warren Foster

A three pig jazz band career is complicated by a wolf they rejected for membership who keeps blowing down their gigs.

Overview: Speedy Gonzales is a 1955 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies animated short directed by Friz Freleng from a story by Warren Foster. The short was released on September 17, 1955, and stars Speedy Gonzales and ...

Release date: 17 September 1955

Genre: Short, Comedy, Family, Animation

Director: Friz Freleng

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Warren Foster

Starving Mexican mice want access to a cheese factory guarded by Sylvester Cat and send for Speedy Gonzales...

Overview: A-Lad-In His Lamp is a 1948 Warner Bros. Looney Tunes cartoon. The short stars Bugs Bunny, and features the Genie and Caliph Hassan Pfeffer, who is after Bugs and the genie in his lamp. The voices of Bugs ...

Release date: 23 October 1948

Genre: Short, Comedy, Family, Animation

Director: Robert McKimson

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Warren Foster

Bugs Bunny finds and rubs Aladdin's lamp and decides to follow the genie to Baghdad, where they battle Mad Man Hassan.

Overview: Boyhood Daze is a 1957 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies cartoon directed by Chuck Jones. The short was released on September 20, 1957, and features young boy Ralph Phillips. Following From A to Z-Z-Z-Z (1954) ...

Release date: 20 April 1957

Genre: Short, Comedy, Family, Animation

Director: Chuck Jones

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Michael Maltese

Young Ralph Phillips is scolded for breaking a window and sent to his room, where he lets his imagination run riot and fantasizes he is in prison...

Overview: Bedevilled Rabbit is a 1957 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies short directed by Robert McKimson. The short was released on April 13, 1957, and stars Bugs Bunny. In this cartoon, Bugs is lost in Tasmania, and ...

Release date: 13 April 1957

Genre: Short, Comedy, Family, Animation

Director: Robert McKimson

Cast: Mel Blanc

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Tedd Pierce

Bugs Bunny is parachuted by airplane in a carrot crate down to Tasmania, where he, of course, meets the Tasmanian Devil.

Overview: Pizzicato Pussycat is a 1955 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies animated short directed by Friz Freleng. The short was released on January 1, 1955.

Release date: 1 January 1955

Genre: Short, Comedy, Family, Animation

Director: Friz Freleng

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Warren Foster

Mr. and Mrs. Jones hear a piano being played in their living room. They automatically assume it is their cat who is making the music...

Overview: Yankee Doodle Bugs is a 1954 Warner Bros. Looney Tunes cartoon short, written by Warren Foster and directed by Friz Freleng. The short was released on August 28, 1954, and stars Bugs Bunny.

Release date: 28 August 1954

Genre: Short, Family, Comedy, Animation

Director: Friz Freleng

Cast: Mel Blanc

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Warren Foster

Bugs lectures his nephew Clyde about early America, inserting himself into events wherever possible.

Overview: 14 Carrot Rabbit is a 1952 Warner Bros. Looney Tunes animated cartoon short directed by Friz Freleng. The short was released on March 15, 1952, and features Bugs Bunny and Yosemite Sam. The title is a ...

Release date: 16 February 1952

Genre: Short, Family, Comedy, Animation

Director: Friz Freleng

Cast: Mel Blanc

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Warren Foster

Bugs goes a little crazy whenever he's standing close to gold, and the trait intrigues claim-jumping Klondike miner Chillicothe (Yosemite) Sam.

Overview: Deduce, You Say! is a 1956 Warner Bros. Looney Tunes cartoon, directed by Chuck Jones and written by Michael Maltese. The short was released on September 29, 1956, and stars Daffy Duck and Porky Pig. The ...

Release date: 29 September 1956

Genre: Short, Comedy, Mystery, Family, Animation

Director: Chuck Jones

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Michael Maltese

Daffy Duck is a detective who is hunting for the Shorepshire Slasher.

Overview: Captain Hareblower is a 1954 Warner Bros. Merrie Melodies theatrical cartoon short directed by Friz Freleng and written by Warren Foster. The short was released on January 16, 1954, and stars Bugs Bunny ...

Release date: 16 February 1954

Genre: Short, Comedy, Family, Animation

Director: Friz Freleng

Cast: Mel Blanc

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Warren Foster

Bugs will not bend to the threats of Pirate (Yosemite) Sam.

Overview: A Star Is Bored is a 1956 Warner Bros. Looney Tunes cartoon, directed by Friz Freleng. The short was released on September 15, 1956, and stars Bugs Bunny and Daffy Duck. The cartoon expands upon the rivalry ...

Release date: 15 September 1956

Genre: Short, Comedy, Family, Animation

Director: Friz Freleng

Producer: Edward Selzer

Writer: Warren Foster

Daffy Duck must double for Bugs in any slapstick which Warners considers too dangerous for its star Bug Bunny.
